SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser
Class Expression

java.lang.Object
  org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Expression

public class Expression
extends java.lang.Object

Expression - base class for real expressions definition. Examples:

  • '1+2'
  • 'sin(x)+1'
  • 'asin(3*x)^10-log(4,8)'
  • in general 'f(x1,x2,...,xn)' where x1,...,xn are real arguments

Class provides easy way to define multivariate arithmetic expression.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mariusz Gromada
mariusz.gromada@gmail.com
http://multifraktal.net/
http://mxparser.sourceforge.net/
See Also:
Argument, RecursiveArgument, Constant, Function

Expression

public Expression(java.lang.String expressionString,
                  Argument... arguments)
Constructor - creates new expression from expression string, and list of arguments given as variadic parameters list. For example: Argument x1 = new Argument("x1"); Argument x2 = new Argument("x2"); Expression exp = new Expression("x1+x2", x1, x2);

Parameters:
expressionString - definition of the expression
arguments - arguments list (comma separated)
See Also:
Argument
